alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:38AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Saddle River near Lodi affecting Bergen County. For the Saddle River...including Lodi...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saddle River near Lodi. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Boys and Girls Club flooded. Saddle Brook flooding roads near Rochelle Park Swim Club. Flooding across the entire parking lot at the Municipal Building in Rochelle Park. At 8.5 feet, Flooding at Washington Elementary School next to Main Street. Water begins to overflow into the parking lot at Felician College. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EST Wednesday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.4 feet on 12/21/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Saddle River Lodi 5.5 8.1 Wed 3 am EST 3.6 2.9 4.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM EST.
